course_title: Studies in Music History and Culture: N. American Indigenous Music
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 8 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as ANT 485W 1)
This course is an introduction to a diverse selection of Indigenous musics of North America. Particular attention will be paid to ways in which music articulates and shapes issues of tradition and modernity, place and identity, revitalization and resurgence, and sovereignty and self-determination. Ethnomusicological and interdisciplinary methods will be used to examine historical and social dynamics behind Indigenous musical and cultural arts in the 21st century.


Music majors: this course counts as a Category B or C.
course_description: This is a variable topics course in music history and culture. Each study treats a special topic in the field by implementing various research methodologies, discussion sessions, and writing of papers.
prerequisites: MUS 200 or MUS_OX 200 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 2785, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 2:30-3:45p, Instructor: H. Senungetuk, Status: Wait List
